intro: Peucedanum davuricum, commonly known as the Siberian cow parsley, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–80 cm, with finely divided, fern-like leaves that emit a distinctive, spicy odor when crushed. Its small white to pale yellow flowers appear in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The roots of Peucedanum davuricum are sometimes used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
